meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unalterable.
meanings.sent1: The inalterability of the ancient ruins amazed the archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: The inalterability of the law ensured fairness for all.
meanings.sent3: The inalterability of the recipe made it impossible to add any new ingredients.
meanings.sent4: Her inalterability in her beliefs made her a pillar of strength in the community.
meanings.sent5: The inalterability of the mountain range was a testament to its enduring beauty.

meanings.definition: The inability to be changed or modified.
meanings.sent1: The inalterability of the contract meant it had to be followed exactly.
meanings.sent2: The inalterability of the weather forecast made planning the event difficult.
meanings.sent3: The inalterability of the traffic light caused frustration among drivers.
meanings.sent4: His inalterability in his decision surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The inalterability of the rule was a source of comfort for the team.
